page.title: 09The Binfield Quilters
page.content: The {Binfield Quilters}are a group of ladies who make patchwork quilts. They meet in the{Baxter Room }of{St.Mark's {Church}on the first Wednesday of every month except in summer. In 1982 they persuaded 16 ladies to make a material{collage and embroidery of their own home. The Quilters made their quilt by sandwiching three layers together. The first layer was plain cotton material.The second layer was a thick padded layer,which keeps you warm.The third layer was the patterned layer,in this case the house pictures. They sewed the pictures together with a maroon flower patterned border.The quilt was finished with a plain maroon edge. The Binfield Quilters exhibit the quilt at Craft Shows and are looking for a permanent home for it.
